intro: Aidia vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Aidia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Aidia vitiensis is primarily found in humid, tropical environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
